28wSNm2qn4mv9l7hH1mpwg.text: First problem was securing a reservation. Trying over a 3 day period unsuccessfully by phone and unable to leave a voicemail cause it was at capacity and finally forced to go in person. The online restaurant website only allowed customers to reserve for advertised events when I only wanted to secure a seat for brunch. Maybe use an online system like Open Table to accommodate all events. Second, music selections. Either play jazz for a jazzy brunch or have a DJ. Having competing music play simultaneously is too much. Mute the tv screens and let one genre play. Pick one music theme and stick with it. Having a baby grand piano with an unskilled vocalist was torture. Third, clear communication between hostess, servers, bar and kitchen. If you no longer carry a brand then provide alternatives. You cannot have a drink menu with items you are out of and have the waitress run back and forth to inquire. Making Moves is a drink special calling for rye and ginger beer and out of two of three major ingredients. Communication is key. If you are out of something provide alternatives in advance to servers so recommendations are lined up and things go smoothly. Presentation is everything and proper plating is necessary no matter who the chef is. Ordered the fried whiting and Grits and received a plate with congealed grits (it sat so long and had cooled off) with whiting served skin side up instead of the meaty part being displayed. My friend and I asked to provide some feedback to the chef, JR Robinson. He came, listened, apologized and offered to make us something else. He singlehandedly saved brunch. There are growing pains but the entire staff must work in tandem with the chef as customers support the face of the establishment which includes service, food and ambiance. My hope is they will thrive and grow and I firmly believe they will!

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Exceptional Fried Catfish and Grits with Lump Crab sauce

mLWHQmHsMcLHuFHrmY5gIg.text: I went there one Sunday evening, pretty decent amount of people were there. Food was good, service was ok. I think it was due to the amount of people. But overall I think it's a good restaurant. The manager came out and spoke with us to make sure our experience was going well. I'll definitely be going back.

a-HbvPnBiBQOSJN_yIsf2g.text: FOUR WORDS: LOBSTER MACARONI AND CHEESE. Literally. The best fried lobster tail I have EVER had!! Omg. I had to FaceTime my mother & BEG HER to come & try this item!! (we pride ourselves as black women who jokingly make the best "Blackaroni n'Cheese" ever..) Aside from the wonderfully light & crunchy batter on the lobster (which was insanely moist & fresh despite being fried) the mac n'cheese was like a Gouda/Cheddar blend or something!!? Amazing. I went on a Thursday night so it was Wing Nite. My friend & I felt obligated to order because half priced... & tried the Jerk BBQ (charred style). Those were pretty gr8 (I'm enjoy a Pescatarian diet so my love for chicken, in general, is pretty weak nowadays) but if you love wings: you'll be impressed. $5 Hurricanes & $3 draft specials honestly made the entire experience incredible... but the SHOW STOPPER ?? I begged the bartender to bring the Chef out (in a strategic attempt to successfully guess what was in the cheese sauce) and he actually came out before the end of our meal to indulge my compliments & playfully jealous sentiments on being a MAN capable of knocking a mac n'cheese out the park!! Wonderful service, cool energy, live DJ after 9p... STATS is a nice time hopefully here to stay!!!

k3b-urI5mhE7xo4mlDtvTA.text: Dope spot, food was great and service was pretty quick , venue is even better Big space with tons of TV's and drinks special for events.... Gotta come to stats. I'll def be back, This what Charlotte needed!!

v6acRkxYhxK7NeGCSJs19A.text: I loved it here. Great good and I really like the ambiance. I came here during the NFL playoffs and the place was packed. I ordered a burger and mac and cheese and it delicious. My friends had some beers and various items on the menu with no complaints. It's a relatively new spot but I'm liking it so far.

_FdONVFs-kdbVFGZiTt9Dg.text: We visited Stats for the first time tonight. It's a nice space in the Davis Lakes community right off of W.T. Harris Blvd. The restaurant is very large and can easily accommodate big parties. It's sports themed with a a lot of floor space (could be a dance floor), multiple TVs, and a large bar. Our waitress was nice, she mentioned she normally doesn't work there but was just helping out for the night. They seemed to lack servers and hostesses when we got there but that could be because we arrived shortly after they opened their doors. There is no Kid's portions which was disappointing...Nonetheless we placed our orders. The kitchen was slow and there was a long wait time to receive our food. I had the fried fish sandwich and fries...both were good. My kids shared the Fish & Chips: the fish comes drizzled with a orange colored sauce that they did not like but I was able to wipe it off. My husband liked his chicken sandwich and fries. Both sandwiches came on a brioche bun (which I love) This spot has a lot of potential for future success. I would recommend making sure they have enough people in the kitchen to move orders out more quickly and ensuring that they have enough servers. I'll definitely be back to check out again in a few months!

d9jpLhHBfZ-ZZN-aOgAscA.text: Lost good and easy money from large party due to poor management and timing. TIP: Keep your word... Say what you mean and mean what you say.

4VcGYeH14xOSzmXG2X-NuA.text: Unfortunately this is one of the worst experiences I have had in a very long time. The wait service lacked communication and timelines. My party came in and sat down for approximately an hour to an hour and half before any food was brought out. The celebrity that was present was serviced well after my party had been seated. The food came out cold and unenjoyable. I would never recommend this place to any one. This is a terrible restaurant.

sH8uxCRCagCsIgz_oYRt6w.text: The waitress was horrible. The food was subpar. The waitress was rude and took forever helping us. It was five of us sitting together and they ended up charging 18% gratuity for our table. I've been a waitress and know from first hand experience that she didn't have a hard time helping a party of five. Also, she seemed unapologetic about the multiple delays and I think it was because she knew she was getting a 18% tip anyway. She didn't write our orders down and kept forgetting what we ordered. Awful. This is the last time I'll ever come here.

-eeEJqnIO4zGwtFGehXJlw.text: This was my first visit but it will not be my last. The food was really good and the set up is nice. Staff was very friendly and management was assessible.

LKqc04Ao7PzPe56tiMOdbw.text: Spinach && crab dip was amazing!! The lobster Mac & Cheese was to die for and the salmon shrimp and grits was yummy as well!! The food was a little slow to come out but we didn't mind because it was piping hot when it arrived at the table. The hubby and I loved the drinks and service we received; we also loved that they played music but not too loud to point that you could not enjoy your conversation. I highly recommend and will definitely go back soon !

T03Ezn_REkJVYrWzZSY-jA.text: I am very pleased by the fresh look of this place. The staff and customer service was great, the hostess was very knowledgeable about the new venue, the menu, and the events that were going to be coming. The menu is simple but a lot of great choices. There's not much on the menu but it's just hard to choose because the options are great.  I chose the chicken and waffles with a side of the cheese grits. The chicken breast was cooked to perfection, very juicy! The waffle was a great compliment to it I enjoy'd the berries that the actually added to the dishes will great plating. The grits were amazing creamy stone grits with just the right amount of cheese. The proportion sizes of all the dishes are great for the price. My friend ordered the fish and grits which she enjoy thoroughly. Our waitress, Gabriel, was very knowledgeable about the menu. The staff actually has eaten everything on the menu so they're able to tell you recommendations, which was a great plus. Overall I give this place a thumbs up love the atmosphere love the ambience staff was great.

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster Mac and Cheese
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Plain wings and fries
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jerk BBQ wings

iiCbcIMbLoOgjfR_ELetTQ.text: Horrible customer service.  Came to watch the fight, took 45 mins for someone to give us water. After receiving our food, we didn't see our waitress for an hour.

SsNPnnByFAAGQxnrWOoxig.text: First time here after the renovation. Was very unsatisfying. Crab dip appetizer took 20 mins to come out. It tasted bland and had 4 pieces of crab sprinkled on top. Main entree came out 15 mins later. Fish extremely bland even with extra aioli sauce.   Really hoped for a better experience.

bvU8qBTjzUEwJVQMWzAomw.text: The food was tasty and the DJ was amazing. However, the service of one waitress was poor, actually she didn't serve us at all. Went on a Friday night to avoid the crowds. I asked a waitress after she passed our couch SEVERAL times we wanted to place an order. She acknowledged and never came back. We literally waited 35 min as she waited on folks all around us. Finally I asked another waitress who was not attending out section to assist. She did and she later explained it wasn't the other waitress's section. I asked whose section it is and she was not sure. I asked why didn't she simply let me know as well as coworkers so an order could be placed. Of course unable to speak on her behalf. I was immediately upset and baffled. Later, the food came, dj continued to spin great music but because of that incident, not sure I'll be back. Service is everything

bwCtPG36ZRL92rGAQIhuNQ.text: The service is always exceptional and the food was spectacular. The manager came to check on us and was very kind. I will definitely be coming back.

VAFXYWBddbe2lswXco0Hfg.text: This is a great spot to watch the game.They have over 15 TV's so you always have a good view of the game. We went on a Sunday to watch the football playoffs and it was busy. I'm surprised there isn't more seating during game days because the space is really big. There was a DJ there which didnt make any sense to me. He only played during the commerical and the music was all wrong for the crowd. The service was really slow, I had to ask my waitress multiple times for my minor things, my check was wrong, and the food was just okay. I might go back but the I would have to sit at the bar for better service.

T_751dID5MBYYwUN5u11Tw.text: I really enjoyed my time at Stats. The atmosphere is AMAZING, the food is GREAT, and the service is AWESOME. If you're looking for somewhere that has a chill vibe and the best drinks in Charlotte look no further bc Stats is the spot!

biEf6gCzNV_cDE0graEcpg.text: Ambiance is great, staff really cool, lobster Mac & Cheese was phenomenal!  I will definitely be back.

XetP--PGTvLaDvDlAuKQFA.text: I was in town visiting some friends, and we came into Stats to catch a few March Madness games. I was just expecting a typical sports bar, beer, wings, nothing over the top. I was very pleasantly surprised. This place had a super chill vibe, tvs everywhere, and was the perfect place to watch a game, but on top of that, their food and drinks were actually fantastic. We ended up staying well past what we originally thought, and had a blast! I absolutely would recommend.

t8WVy-bhjXol6HpPg5YQ6A.text: Slow service.  Bartenders can not handle a crowd and move super slow.  No order and no customer service considered.

H24nl6TCnScRv0ag9cuL4Q.text: We came here on  a Thursday around 5ish. We walk in and get seated. My first thought was nice atmosphere, the food must be pretty good too. But thats where it all ended, so they were playing this really loud, really offensive rap music with the n word, p word, and F word , all with sexual references over and over again. After we ordered our drinks we decided we couldnt take the offensive music anymore so we left before ordering our food. You have got to be kidding me, why would they play that crap so loud with customers in the restaurant?? There was also a family with a young baby seated across from us. I'll take my hard earned money elsewhere.

D22-txalC3SBSOCn-F6EMA.text: This place is POPPIN! Been here a couple times. First for the Super Bowl and then again for their anniversary and each time the place was packed. There was a good mix of men/women and good vibes. I like that there is a police presence to make sure things stay in order. The food was good. The jerk wings were tasty and so was the mac and cheese. Drinks are reasonably price and the music is always good

ZkOn5hVYukHbRaesI8u_BQ.text: Food is amazing but the service is slow. There's no sense of urgency to attend to the guest. I only see a waitress at the beginning of my order and when I receive my food. If there's room for improvement it's the service. Just the urgency and attentiveness to guest. The attitude of the staff is pretty good.

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish and grits

r98T6HfRW_VGV8tXN_vD1A.text: So first and foremost they have excellent customer service from the front door to the table. We went for a friends bikers Halloween  event . Primarily for support. While there was miscommunication about the event. We ended up sitting at a table on the upper deck and ordering food off the late night Menu. We were a little irritated that we didn't get a menu when we sat down. And we waited a while for one (5 mins) and even longer for waters unfortunately. The several waitresses we had prior to being assigned to us were trying to be helpful. The place is REALLY REALLY NICE ascetically. From the lighting to layout and decor it's very trendy sports bar! The late night menu is only the left side, which is primarily everything but entrees. The menu doesn't have many options (at all) and is pretty basic. My friends got wings. He said they were salty and they looked better than they taste. The other friend got wings as well- he said they were basic nothing spectacular. They messed his order by putting salt on the fries when he asked them not too. There was a woman who- I'm assuming was the manager -made sure they corrected his meal right away; While the waitress tried to take his entire plate away the manager woman made sure he got a fresh batch. The waitress had a lot of patience and kindness . I don't eat red meat so when I asked if I chili's get chicken cheesesteak fries she made it happen. Overall, great atmosphere- okay food- awesome service!

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dirty fries= chicken cheesetake on top of seasoned fries . It was good to me
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

46rg5Sk9mKgUrnKoIRgfxQ.text: Fish and grits dish was incredible.  My hubby got the chicken and red velvet waffle which was also delicious. Good restaurant vibe and good service.  Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

oa8yx3A1qTG8gyOqIIXf6A.text: Had a awesome time last night celebrating my birthday with friends and family. Clyde accommodated me on short noticed with celebrity treatment. My guest were impressed with Stats private area and some inquired about having their own event in the future. Staff was friendly responding quickly to request. Our waitress Resa was polite and professional throughout while waiting on over 50 guest.  I highly recommend speaking with Clyde or other members of management on having your event there. They will customize a package for you.

SQkkPNK25_hd6BGiycZFIQ.text: Stats...Sports bar...Brunch until 3?  Sorry...not a Sports bar...light jazz music playing in the background.  All the TVs had football in them...but that's as far as the sports vibe goes.  With as limited as the menu is, not sure what to call this place.

NPQ5YP4RTYmb2S7U5RqwRA.text: The atmosphere and the food was good. The presentation however not consistent. The salt and pepper shakers looked like it was wet so we couldn't use it. Some people in my party returned their grits but others said they liked theirs. The chicken and waffle was good but some plates had more chicken than others. Overall there were Lil things that we didn't enjoy like waiting a very long time for our food but the waitress was nice and the majority of us truly enjoyed our meals.

0VZowg9WFRTtOjKXKv-0EQ.text: So far we've been here twice, for dinner on a Tuesday and a Saturday brunch both times the food has been delicious. The fish and grits was absolutely delicious , my husband had the cheesesteak omelet who was very good. Service was great as well. I would recommend this spot. Please try it.. we will be back again.

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mai tai
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. I had the lobster Mac and cheese, wish was very delicious. My husband had the Philly cheesesteak wish was also very good.

HGAKXst4aMtauN3MazH6Tg.text: We purchased a table.  The info said that we could be there as early as nine but nlt eleven.  We arrived at 945 and due to the security pulling favors and allowing people in before us, we are just getting in and sitting down. This is terrible customer service and the fact that we paid one thousand dollars definitely makes it much worse.  We came all the way from DC, paid a grand and stood outside in the cold... then got in and sat at a couch that sat three when we paid for six.. smh!  Messaged stats, they read and ignored my message.  Dougie and the rest was dope as hell!! Stats is a no go for my next visit to Charlotte. The least they could have done was responded to my message.

xjwNFZV97mQZwgk_8kuXOg.text: Great Atmosphere! Such life and great service to bring to the Northlake area. I will be visiting and tell all about the bartender Blu. Also the size and flow is great for parties and friends can't wait to see this place breathe new life into Charlotte! Between the great drinks, great food, and booming DJ hell I'll just say it; Stats stay Lit

97Pc6O3IdssfDx_zjwaK-A.text: So this may just be my new favorite restaurant/bar/lounge. I loved almost everything about this place, from the service to the food to the music. My cousin and I arrived around 11 p.m. We found two seats at the bar and within a minute or two were greeted by a very friendly bar tender. My cousin and I ordered tequila mixed with orange juice and the bartender was was not stingy with the tequila. We were only there for about an hour and a half but the entire time the bartender was friendly and attentive, which is the main reason I will be back. We ordered two orders of wings and I also ordered their famous lobster and crab mac n cheese. The only thing I will say about their lobster and crab mac n cheese is that I did not see or taste one bit of crab in the it. However, the fried lobster tail that they place on top was hot and super good along with the creamy mac n cheese. The wings were good too! All of our food came out fairly quickly and was piping hot! I feel the food and drinks are reasonably priced as well. For two orders of wings, lobster and crab mac n cheese, two tequila and orange juice drinks and two double shots of tequila, the bill was $90. I would say that's a really good deal! The music was also EXACTLY what I wanted to hear, a nice mix of old and new. I also loved the mature crowd! One last thing I wanted to mention was the customer service. From the security to the ladies at the front desk to our bartender, everyone was so friendly. That definitely stood out to me because the customer service at establishments these days leaves MUCH to be desired. I will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

r3Ii2C-_Q7m3vQtIrBOJUw.text: Great meal... Loved the ambiance.  Servers were superior and provided prompt and appropriate level of attention. The grilled salmon.was on point and was served with fresh steamed broccoli on a bed of rice. Delicious. Will definitely return

4jpmKqE6TF1YSRIHe98lmw.text: If you're a beer connoisseur, this is not the place for you. There's nothing on draft and their bottles selection is sparse to say the least. I tried to start off with an appetizer of fried pickles, but after our food came out, the server asked me did I still want them (I'm assuming she forgot) and I said yes. Never received them. Then I ordered a double shot with a chaser or diet on the side. It took 3 more trips for her to bring me the chaser. I order a chicken philly, which was good, but I had to wait 7 minutes for her to come back with the proper condiments and silverware before I could begin to eat. Then the server complained that she was paying all the attention to us, as if it's our fault that she couldn't just write everything down at once so she's remember it. The drunken apple cheesecake was delightful. The food itself was great, the service just could've been better.

B7rUB5DE2yIt-6Y9G9s8cg.text: Never been here before but my very first time coming, had a party of four and was totally ignored. My friends ordered drinks and it never came, after 45 minutes we tried to wave down a waitress and she didn't even look our way.   A table that was seated after us got drinks and food so we decided to leave. We understand it was packed but someone could have at least acknowledged we were there and told us she'd be with us whenever she got a chance. Totally unacceptable service... probably could have been a great place to eat too.

hYdkxz4th2S42loSOVCaUg.text: This place is hot garbage! I have been here before for drinks and came back with some girlfriends a couple of weekends ago. I'll keep it short. Terrible, slow service, snotty waitresses, and overly salted food. Let me add, the hostess actually wound up taking care of our table after us sitting there for about 20 minutes trying to flag down servers. She was great, but everyone else sucked. Will I come back? Negatory. Too many other good places to go in this city. Good day, STATS!!

VVvAnobpw9NXUJWAbIrLyA.text: Went there today for brunch and it was a disaster! I ordered the Blackened Salmon with eggs Benedict crab cake pouched egg with hollindaise sauce!! The photo attached will detail what i actually received. The cheese grits were good but they were cold. The potato's with onions and peppers were good and warm! This was my first time eating brunch there and my last. The atmosphere is a sports bar which is nice... the brunch menu could use a little work. Our server Crystal was very nice and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

p4_QzuxVB457XtYPm3qL0g.text: This bar used to be Blue Notes, which was going down hill. I like the new renovations at Stats, but I think they are trying to compensate through their prices. Their drink and food prices are waaaaay too high! Also the sound system needs a little work. If you want to charge upscale prices, it needs to be an upscale club, ijs.

KwazwdV3_ydrGFl6DT-67Q.text: Friendly staff and good food. It's so close to home and I don't have to travel uptown for a good time.  I will be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon plater
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab spinach dip

1eq9b6SCST-MlBO7ES57RA.text: My friend is always raving about this place so I decided to tag along with her tonight. I ordered an apple martini an drunken apple cheesecake. Both were extremely delicious. The bartender Ess was very attentive in making sure our visit was pleasant and I appreciate it. I will definitely be back for a second time.

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Apple

1NbzZMso3LBVa7WLc0fSBg.text: As it's only been open a couple months, it's not a surprise that tonight was my first time visiting the restaurant and bar. What is surprising is how good food could leave such a bad aftertaste in my mouth.  The service was fairly good, although the server didn't know what beers were available on draft. As there were only six beers on draft, I'm thinking he might want to brush up on his memorization skills. But he was very attentive, when asked for anything from anyone (extra napkins, another drink, silverware for new arrivals) he always brought it promptly, and he was very likable. I have no complaints about the service.  I ordered the Curveball Club Sandwich. The description made it sound like a normal club sandwich, but instead of a traditional club served on three thin slices of toast, I got a turkey and bacon sandwich served on two thick slabs of Texas toast.  To the preparer's credit, the meat and toppings were arranged evenly across the entire sandwich. As anyone who's ordered a sandwich anywhere from Arby's to the higher-end chain restaurants can attest, that's unusual. Most of the time, all the meat and toppings are plopped in the middle without a second thought. So I appreciate the obvious care the preparer took when making my sandwich.  But I wasn't expecting a turkey and bacon sandwich on very thick toast.  It had a good flavor - the turkey and bacon were both very good - but after finishing most of the first half of the sandwich, I realized there was no cheese in the sandwich, even though the description of the club specifically mentioned cheddar cheese. It's funny, because even after adjusting my expectations upon seeing the non-club club sandwich, something felt off, but I was too busy talking to my friends to notice there wasn't any cheese at first.  I asked the waiter if he'd bring me a half a slice of cheddar for the other half of my sandwich, as I was planning on bringing it home to eat later. At that point, I felt like it would be silly to put some cheese on the remains of the first half of my sandwich.  A couple of minutes later, he came back to the table and told me there was no cheddar cheese available in the kitchen, but he could bring me a slice of American cheese.  The restaurant had been open for less than an hour. It was not busy. I can't imagine why they did not have any cheddar cheese. The restaurant is located maybe a couple thousand yards from a Food Lion, and maybe a half mile at best from a Harris Teeter, and they had no cheddar cheese. This is a restaurant that offers cheeseburgers. And they had no cheddar cheese.  Evidently, they named it the Curveball Club because it wasn't actually a club sandwich and it didn't contain the cheese promised in the description. Randomly bizarre, much?  With all that said, I have to say I wasn't unhappy. Again, the service was good, the food was good even without the cheese, and the people I was with seemed to enjoy their meals. In my mind, I was already composing how I'd describe the thick toast and lack of cheddar cheese to my friends later when describing my dinner.  BUT THEN I GOT THE BILL.  I was planning on giving this restaurant three stars. I don't think it's the greatest, but it's not the kind of place I'd normally eat in anyway, and while the lack of cheese (or rather the explanation for the lack of cheese) was weird, it wasn't a bad sandwich, even if it wasn't a club sandwich.  But I ended up being charged $23 for the meal - $5.00 for each of the two beers I drank and $13.00 for the sandwich. It wasn't until I got home and thought about it that I realized they had overcharged me by $3 for a sandwich that wasn't even what was described. The menu said it was $10. I verified on their website that it's $10. But they charged me $13.  I could live with that - it's only $3 - but then...  They also tried to con me into paying a tip twice.  They charged me a $4.14 gratuity. That's standard - most restaurants charge an 18% tip for groups of six or eight. But on the final bill, the one you write the tip in and sign, there was no mention whatsoever that the subtotal included that 18% gratuity charge. Instead, there was a tip guide letting you know how much to tip on a total that ALREADY INCLUDED AN 18% TIP.  I paid $29 for a moderately good sandwich and two small draft beers.  And then they want to try and trick me into paying a second tip.  So yeah, I'm not giving them three stars. I'm giving them one.  And if you have a problem with that, you can pay the $9.90 tip I would have given if I hadn't been paying attention on an overpriced $23 meal. (That includes the $4.14 tip charged automatically since I was part of the group and the $5.76 recommended tip I would have paid if I hadn't checked the original bill and seen that the tip was already included in my subtotal.)  That's some devious crap they're trying to get away with.

qjpKfkevSgfn3trpktTXqA.text: I have visited Stats twice before prior to moving to Charlotte and enjoyed the atmosphere and bar area. Tonite I had the pleasure of dining here and had a wonderful experience. The server, Gabrielle, was excellent and the food was wonderful. We will definitely return!

0WCI5TWI3Mlxi0N5wEv-2A.text: I'm almost afraid to write this review, this location has been so many different things, it may change again before I complete my review.  I stopped by after church for brunch after reading some of the reviews.  I thought it was more of a bar, but when I walked in someone was singing and playing the piano......weird but ok.  They have a limited brunch menu which is good.  I ordered the fish and grits with butter crab sauce according to the menu, but when it came out I didn't see any crab even though the picture on their instagram page clearly shows crab but I was told it's just a sauce and if I wanted crab I had to request it.....um, ok.....crab please.  That combo of fish, grits, and crab was superb!  Creamy grits, perfectly seasoned fish, and lump crab.....no words.  I also tried the chicken and waffles, it was pretty good but the waffle was soft which I asked for it to be crispy.  I was impressed with how good the food was and will be returning soon.

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Apps menu
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brunch menu
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

fziEYJ4e4xKF4_f-1RRMMg.text: The customer service is excellent. Well trained staff. Big improvement over blu notes.  However, this is not really a sports bar.  I kinda felt like they need to make up their mind.   Jazz music? They need to pick a theme and stick to it.  The decor was classy and then they have tacky fake grass as a carpet.  I get it.  Supposed to look like a football field. But it just doesnt match.   I hope it lasts though.  It was pretty empty on a Friday happy hour which is never a good sign.   They should advertise to all the business parks near by. Especially Wells Fargo and IBM drive area. Better signage out front would help. The sign is not very visible from the main road.

cEGT1pphy9htIPYUX4wqlg.text: The wait here is really long. Food is mediocre. I wouldn't waste my time going back honestly. We spent like 2 1/2 hours here

CKtbT080NMoDk3IH8sMZCA.text: So we came here to watch one of the basketball games and also have dinner. my friends orders chicken wings with fries and shrimp and my order was chicken wings am I to friends order chicken wings and the other 1 ordered shrimp. My friend that order shrimp she sent it back because it was so so so so so so so sad salty she even had me tasted and I spit it out it was horrible. The waiter took it back to thr kitchen.  a few moments later as she come down with a second order of shrimp and she said that and she said that she told the cook that it was salty and that he would change the batter because the batter mixture with action and salty so he would change it here goes shop number 2 she took 1 bite and it was extremely softly she asked me to taste it and it was the exact same saltiness as the 1st goal horrible horrible horrible I cannot believe that they would take back the plane and send out the exact same the that makes no sense so my other friend that daughter queens with a flavor they brought her the 1 with the wrong flavor and heard with also salty and coal so she sent her niece back and then it came back out the next time and she ate it my wings that I order or app center in the licious I have 0 issues for my beverage I have water I have 0 issues with my glass of water my friend however had alcoholic drink and they said that they were delicious and they enjoy your dreams service here on any particular day or time is slow not the normal slow this is a normal slowly You see many many waitresses running around lap to light just running running running running running go on back-and-forth to the kitchen back a forth to the bar but you don't see many plate so I food coming out or drinks coming out and on an average most times when I have busied it is a establishment I normally have to wait 20 to 30 minutes for my alcoholic drink from the bar so since I have given this establishment many many Many chances I have to decide to stop coming here also I was told that the new hangout spot is down the street and another local bar and so that's where I'm gonna try next time when I decide to yatsh a sporting event on TV with my friends

av9aRAsuvnn_caSmr3cVPA.text: The only thing i like here is the food! I have attempted to attend 2 events here and both times i was not pleased. They try to be organized but then end up being unorganized! We were given a time for the doors to open ..to only be standing outside for an additional 30 mins. At most places if you get there early there is at least a couple tables to claim on fcfs but not here. We were told the cheapest table was 250 and up smh. Everyone knows women need to rest every so often. They chose to let around 10 tables sit empty all night instead of given them to paying customers. Yes i said paying cause we still paying at the door. I believe customer service should be your no 1 priority instead of the celebrities and money. They opened the doors at 9 and the celebrity dj didn't come out until after midnight. I chose to leave right before. If you take care of people your business will last a long time. This place has changed ownership so much. I really hope they do better in certain areas. I probably won't attend another event here.

eRbVpvGR6jPK4XzWdpggWg.text: Came here AllStar Weekend to see Kid Capri, Dougie Fresh and Biz Markie. Was excited until we got to the door. The event was supposed to start at 9:00, me and wifey got there about 8:30 thinking we were going to be late. They had us and hundreds of others standing out in the cold (freezing) for an hour or more and they were letting people just walk up to the front of the line and didn't do anything. Once we got in (think goodness we came early) seating was very limited and a free for all. Some folks (like us) were being seated and a lot just ran to table's and sat down. The food we ordered was pretty good and came to the table pretty fast. Our waitress was very attentive and checked on us often, she gets  stars for her service . Dougie Fresh put on a good show, Kid Capri was cool and I was very disappointed in Biz Markie. I grew up listening to Dougie and Biz Markie and they were among my favorites. Just expected a little more from Biz .

j9f5hMnXsiH67LoswEB0iw.text: Hands down the best Sports bar in Charlotte this location is Ink N Ivy Meets Charlotte Urban Premier Clientele perfect for events, watching the game or just lounging on a Friday night! Wish this place the best of luck and much success! Food is amazing as well.

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Basketball Court in the Best Sports Bar in Charlotte

smBBmV7TuOW27DajwBCDEA.text: I like this sports bar. They have daily specials and the food is bomb. They always have a nice crowd and different events throughout the week and on the weekend. This is the go to spot for that 30 and over crowd if your in the University area.

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Daily Specials

Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

RWJJ4JQp1sG4aPEExGvcEQ.text: I would really like to say good things about this establishment but I am beyond irritated with the level of service I have recieved every single time I've been here.  The food that I tasted was decent. But the terrible service outshines anything I could ever eat. Word of advice: Train your staff with a standard of excellence. You could be amazing.   -From A Service Professional

NeE_GkDiR1eUk5SJVgVCqA.text: This place had a good vibe, music was good, and food was even better. I ordered the salmon Alfredo and it was amazing!!!!! It was so good I didn't get a chance to take a pic! But next time I'll try and get a pic before I dive in. The service was pretty good. This is an overall chill place to go with friends. I recommend for a girls night or casual date night. I will return.

0cMJMUA_qL1i5sBr5rBgeQ.text: The food has been great, however, I do agree with some of the other reviews in reference to the service. It's not that busy, but things seem to take forever to come to the table. Overall, I will come back though.

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

vlZFlADzTkVIqGssWtBP7w.text: Stats restuarant is awesome.  We had a great time there.... I will definitely be going back there again.

emRhJ4sx1RTs81LWELJWrg.text: I was invited to Stats for brunch . It was a Sunday afternoon and the restaurant was setting up for their Sunday brunch. It wasn't many people at the time but people were coming in here and there . There was music playing as well which was nice. The lady at the waffle station seemed to be having a difficult time as well watched several time she had to start over. We opted out of the buffet as I'm not a fan of buffets and it seemed like they needed some more time . I did order the fish and grits minus the sausage. The guy beside me asked about my meal and told his waitress to order him the same thing but they unexpectedly hooked him up with crab meat so I felt a little slighted lol  . I thought my food was good despite that . My mimosa was ok. It wasn't a super memorable experience but I may come back if the opportunity arises .

bAu7DUBPm8tXgngesU8KAg.text: Visiting Charlotte and decided to give this place a try. There was no one at the desk when we walked in, so we proceeded to seat ourselves. 10 minutes later we were asked to move, which was no big deal to us. Once we placed our order, the food took an hour to come out. It looked like it was going to taste phenomenal but reality was none of it was finger looking good. I will say the hostess became our waitress and her service was excellent.

4hskfvlfQ1sxfoJEXvBnIA.text: This place has a nice chill vibe. I was invited here on a Sunday to attend a birthday brunch with a group of friends! This is a great place to go grab a bite to eat with a group or even by yourself if you please. There's a bar for you to order a nice drink and you can even order hookah to smoke. This is a great spot to watch football on Sundays.   When I walked in for the brunch I was greeted by a pianist. She was singing as well. This really set the mood for an upscale restaurant . But when I stepped further in and got comfortable I realized that it was actually a laidback atmosphere.   I really enjoyed myself and even thought the food was delicious! I ordered the fish and grits and they served me a big portion, so big I was able to share! The service was also very good as well! The waitress continuously asked if everything was ok, so I was pleased with that!   When I looked at the prices I thought it was rather pricey but when the food came out I then realized you definitely get your moneys worth! I can't wait to visit this spot again!

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie Omelette
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bowl of fruit
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish and Grits

JqKI2Tem86orVau-kavWzA.text: My first visit was nice! It was not too crowded and the music was great! I love the patio area which was needed after dancing. The crowd was a bit young for me but I enjoyed myself! Definitely want to return for brunch!!

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

nmoE2IYUGqqBwko08WAzmA.text: My mom and Auntie were in town from Florida. I wanted to plan a girl's night out. Wednesday Sound stage was perfect. Great live band, atmosphere, and talented singers.  Leslie and Kiara were super attentive and checked on us throughout the night. The food was great and the half off martinis and wine were an added bonus.

PwDOeI4gscYEO22iYtpUfg.text: Oh how i wish i could give this place 5 stars!.. I posted pictures just so everyone can see just how nice this little spot is for a sports bar this is the place to be. My friend and I stepped in this place and had been sitting for at least a good 30 minutes before someone finally came to  our table and spoke then told us oh we will be closing at 5 pm and the kitchen closes in 15 minutes so i don't want to rush you states the waitress. My friend had already mentioned from us sitting for awhile see this is why i can't do a black  owned establishment, that really hurt me to hear her say that because i really wanted to give this place a chance and the food looks awesome. Maybe i will try it again on a off day and see what happens and maybe we will have a better experience. With that being said we just got up and kindly walked out.

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

FBbCeZrBsJG8B9g4AHv0Cw.text: I was thoroughly excited to check this place out, as it has been a variety of restaurants over the years. Decided to give this place a try for brunch on a Sunday, because there weren't many cars in the parking lot so I figured the service would be swift and I would be in and out. Eh, I was wrong... but not entirely. Upon entering the restaurant, I like the fact that they've aimed to keep it themed with the name, as the area around the bar has football field markers. I also enjoyed the the pianist that provided music until it was time for kick off.   We were seated quickly, but it took us a little while for our waitress to acknowledge us and get our drink orders. It took about 10 minutes for our drinks to arrive and about 15 minutes for coffee, because it had to be brewed first. I was little confused, as it was brunch time, so I'm not sure as to why coffee was not one of the first things ready... but I was grateful for it when it came and didn't feel the need to complain since our waitress was nice.   We ordered our food and waited...during this time we noticed that a couple of people that came in around the same time as us, but sat at the bar, were pleasantly enjoying their meals. The elevated area we were in was not crowded but I only counted 2 or 3 waitresses, which should have been enough but there obviously was a lack of urgency with getting food orders out...not sure if that was on the kitchen or the lackadaisical of the servers. Our waitress, aware that we were now going on 30+ minutes waiting, didn't see the need to swing by our table to update us on the status of our orders. I think continuous communication is important, especially with new establishments. We finally received our food... the presentation was great but the taste was just OK. I ordered the chicken and waffles, but the chicken was meh.   I will have to try this place out again, maybe for dinner though. Overall, I look forward to improved efficiency from on service side of things.

REAkyL9Gz1N7ECOBZCiuvg.text: The lobster Mac n cheese was good. The Cajun Alfredo was decent. Not a huge portion though. If you're super hungry, I wouldn't recommend getting. Food took a little while to come out, but we did have a large group. Not a lot on the drink menu & no drink specials. Servers were nice & personable.

tuHNiSoqi1uBapJIYrJS0w.text: I give credit for the taste of the food and the atmosphere however the service is piss poor and out doesn't pay to ever sit in VIP for any event.  The DJ kept saying " keep your glass full" but how can you when your assigned waitress never comes to see what you need.  I'm taking my flask the next time

fLhTvge5LMYz5gYjxBIqpw.text: Came here with a friend to watch the game they have the greatest intentions. The resultant took a  while with the food but I don't think they planned on such a huge crowd but still always plan for a hug crowd on game day. The TVs were all around but could be turned up a bit because  the DJ would randomly play music during commercials it was a lot at times when your trying to talk.  The atmosphere was good

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

KzoOgKh-BCoSOaJWXAWIuA.text: I came back from my hometown after the Thanksgiving holiday yearning for something worth it for my "last" cheat day. I was not disappointed! I put last in quotations because I am quite unsure that I will be able to resist going back, lol! Any who! Let's get into was ordered! A friend and I ordered three items: the beef empanadas, the fish and grits and the lobster mac and cheese. The beef empanadas were perfectly seasoned and crispy, we didn't get a chance to try the sauce (we scarfed them down before realizing the sauce was in the bag! Lol), the fish and grits were amazing!!!! They reminded me of home (Charleston, SC) the fish perfectly seasoned and crispy, the grits creamy, and the crab added a perfect touch. The lobster Mac and cheese, lawd! I was so mad I didn't order them myself but I tried it and needless to say I will be back for that!

Zst5tbd2RuGCLYhKvNUJRw.text: This place has potential. They are at a very good start if you ask me just a few tweaks here and there. Our server was either extremely new or extremely nervous when helping us; she was very sweet but made things awkward when coming to check on us. I ordered the fish tacos with a side of Mac and my friend ordered the sliders with fries. The food was basic to me nothing I would crave but maybe something i would grab if I was in the area. The drinks were good though so def a good spot for your bar preferences.

C2s-hTHY2qaWsfLzaPfQ8A.text: No stars from me ... I came to celebrate my friends 40th bday...I made reservations over a month ago and when I arrived the hostess acted like she didn't know what I was talking about and keep asking me who I talked too. I asked for manager and Mgr came over she said she would assist and the Mgr never came back. I finally got a call to say they had a table but when I came to hostess stand no one came over. So we had left. I have been to Stats many times and I usually like it but a word of advice for management you need to train your staff better whether I'm a man or woman I should be treated the same.  It will be a min before I come back to spend my money.   I'm only putting one star because it didn't let post w/out doing so.

zFCOB-P39AZOtcfwtTrJog.text: Stats is a beautiful establishment with a great outdoor patio for socializing and mingling. The inside space is also enjoyable, because of the awesome sound system, and lighting. However, the bartenders are the absolute worse. They move extremely slow, they serve all men before women on purpose, and they have horrible attitudes!   Would I visit this establishment again? NO

2srNCMz810NHLvJJ4OsyjA.text: Drinks to expensive and do not taste like the brand you purchased.  After trying 3 different drinks I was more than sure they pour bottom shelf alcohol into the top shelf bottles.  Bartenders slow beyond belief.  Best thing about location is the look...very clean and usually a great DJ.    My recommendation is go drunk and enjoy the party. You might leave mad as hell if you drinking that top bottom shelf with a high cost and slow service....

NEpOHpHO1jpWsT2aW4Sp6A.text: Went here to watch the fight. Got tickets specifically for the fight. We arrived early because of the potential to not be able to find a park. Our waitress was really nice and attentive. The drinks were decent but we did notice that the more people that started to come in around 10pm, the glasses got smaller. I promise. I wish I would have taken a pic to show the difference. My take from that was if you want a standard size drink, you need to get there before 10. Anyway, we ordered fish and wings. The fish was plentiful. The wings were drenched in honey BBQ sauce. My boo got a really bad stomachache from eating them. Not sure if it was the sauce or what. But we could not stay for the main event because she was sick from the wings and needed to go home. The fish and fries were pretty good. I didn't like how they drizzled the aioli all over the fries but otherwise it was good. The price was pretty reasonable for the type of place that it was.   So this place is definitely a nightclub and not a sports bar. At no point could we hear the fight. Only able to see it. So please keep that in mind. The music was loud and there are people dancing around you while you are trying to watch T.V.  After sitting there for about 3 hours because we were eating and watching the game. We were told our table had been sold and we had to get up! So I guess if you are at a table and don't order anything after a certain amount of time you have to go stand up. I had never experienced anything like this but okay.   Overall it was a cool place if you are into the night club scene but if you want to go chill and watch the game, this place is not it.

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is the fish. While good I didn&#39;t like that the orange sauce was all over the fries
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. These are the honey BBQ wings that made my date very sick!

PvdVZrkaWkppYEMTXRL8Nw.text: I've been hearing local club goers rave over the food at STATS and though I've been here to party before I had never ordered from the menu. Popped in for brunch to see what the hype was about and in sum the food was bomb but the service left much to be desired.   We arrived around 12:30 pm (they open at noon on Sunday's) and was greeted by a pleasant young lady that directed us to the bar because "there are no servers here for y'all to get a table."   Me: "ookkkayy?  So we head over to the bar where we are again quickly greeted and asked if we wanted a bar seat or table. We explained what we were told by the hostess and then we were redirected to a high top. On the way over the manager? stopped to tell the hostess that she had a server available. We were handed off to the hostess who led us to the table mumbling something about forgetting there was a sever.   We were seated and observed that we were the only two ppl in the space with the exception of one other person and two small children. Their mother was our waitress and after several moments she came over and got our drink order. We ordered everything all at once because hunger. We waited a longer time than expected for our appetizer to come out and the entree and for refills on water and for the table to be cleared etc. To be fair our waitress was very nice but I'm not sure if the issue was that she had other tasks to do in the kitchen or she was watching her children in another room or what but all the waiting is why I'm not giving this place at least 4 stars. Well that and the nuances like: the we don't have takeaway cups because someone ordered the wrong size, the dollar store "steak knives" that were so flimsy I actually considered that I may injure myself trying to cut my chicken, it was freezing (but that could be just me)  The food was very well seasoned and the music was great. I would try this place again. Maybe during the week. Hopefully the service is better.

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lemon pepper chicken
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and (red velvet) waffles
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish n&#39;grits

fYZH6OKe3lnv3fVqiUymtQ.text: I really like this place. Vibe is cool, the food is delicious & the staff is decent. Only issue on why I wouldn't give it 5 stars is the drinks I feel are watered down a lot of times & my last visit my friend was approached by staff accusing us of not paying our tab because we got up to use the restroom. Like until you see me attempt to leave out the door how dare you accuse me of not paying my bill. It was very embarrassing to say the least. I'm not going to hold poor judgment of one of the waitresses against this place because their chicken wings are just too good to never not go back haha but seriously I do really like this spot & id probably go more often if it wasn't so far from where I live at.

0L8DvureuAkRafsc1_yISg.text: Very disappointed in this experience. I waited 1 hour and 32 minutes for a meal that should have taken 25 minutes. There were several people who came in after me and got their food WAY before I did. I was highly disappointed in the customer service as well, the server seemed nonchalant and disengaged at times. I love the atmosphere but the food and customer service didn't correlate. This place was SO much better when it was Blunotes. Very disappointed and will not recommend this place to my worst enemy.

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

TaMeoHsb3z_ahTW--mocSA.text: I am very disappointed in the service at this restaurant. I walked in and was very excited - the TVs, music, and sports theme created a very fun ambiance.   Sat down and was greeted by a friendly server. Ordered drinks, appetizers and food right away. Took 30 min for the drinks to arrive and an entire hour for the food to come. I would have excused it had the food been hot, but it came pretty cold. I ordered the Stats Trio - my mozzarella sticks were so cold that they looked like fish sticks.   Everyone else at my table had their orders come out incorrectly and the Mariana sauce we ordered twice never came.   Very disappointing.

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tennessee mule
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cold mozzarella sticks.

Ckq-_wZQ32XxxGiGrB2V0g.text: The reason I am giving this restaurant such a low review is because of the service I received & quality of food.   I ordered a house salad minus croutons with extra Caesar dressing on the side, Southwest BBQ (turkey) burger minus bacon and the drunken apple cheesecake.   When my salad came out, it was ranch dressing and not Caesar. I had to request my extra dressing. That was Caesar, so I had two different salad dressings. The drunken apple cheesecake was disappointing. It tasted like regular store bought cheesecake with apple slices and a thin sauce. I should've gotten the banana pudding cheesecake LOL. The fries were room temperature.   What was good about the food was the southwest BBQ turkey burger. They weren't stingy with The amount of cheese and I'd never had onion rings on a burger before,  but I'll def do it again. It was SO good!  The music was entirely too loud and it was dark. My friends and I literally had to yell to speak to each other.   I honestly think they're understaffed. I felt sorry for our waitress because she was ripping and running the entire time. Despite that fact, she was super nice and apologetic for our delay. It took one of us 45 min to get our food. Everyone else at our table had already eaten. I felt bad for her.

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

U9YRK8BV9TUypiNheCiSDw.text: We had a great time watching the top 4 finalists sing their hearts out for the $500 grand prize. The event was hosted by Sunshine Anderson who also performed at the end. Also, the live band was killing it! They played played the songs for each contestant and then had some great mashups in between. This place had great energy,  There were $5 martinis that night and wine was half off. If I remember correctly, they have that special every Wednesday. I didn't have any food this go around because, but I will be sure to try it next time.  This is a nice spot to check out for the live band alone.

wseetID-ws6i-dYIMA8yfQ.text: Really wanted the lobster mac n cheese, but they ran out! So instead I had the crab grilled cheese sandwich with a side of mac, which was great but the side of mac was too cheesy for us and not baked enough. The shrimp alfredo & chicken and waffles were really good too! Also, the wait for the food was a little long.

vRQgDh8oA1-ezP9AmkUBrw.text: Stats is a nice restaurant and the food is amazing. I love to visit and I typically visit the bar to be served by Lauren. She is a wonderful bartender and provides great customer service. Everything on the menu taste great and the music is nice as well. This is definitely a good spot where you can chill and have a great time with friends.

k-AthU2K4y8VZQ54IVPVjw.text: Good vibes here, I went for Laugh it Off Thursdays, that was fun. Good indoor and outdoor seating and great crowd. The food was okay, but the drinks were great! The customer service was decent.

kCwCssz42BaD_QgxVr2wmg.text: Perfect place for watching the game. I'll definitely be back. Experienced some of the best service I've had while in Charlotte.  My waitress was super attentive. The rum punch was great (and strong lol). The food was amazing and there are options for everybody (including vegetarians). Several TVs around and great music playing. The atmosphere was all around great.

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States

fMXvO_tjb8my6LWmn39-KQ.text: Calvin from Denver, CO   Shout out to STATS RESTAURANT and BAR,  The Owners, Event coordinator Lezlie, and the ENTIRE STATS staff. You all are SUPER AWESOME. Thank you for helping make my Surprise Valentines Day Marriage Proposal to the Love of my Life an Epic and Memorable Night. I met my now Fiance at STATS when I first came to Charlotte, NC. It was there when she stole my fry and my heart and we've been together ever since. My Fiance and I will never forget February 14, 2019 NBA ALL-STAR WEEKEND!!!   If your traveling to Charlotte and you need somewhere to eat, dance, listen to great music or even plan an event, I highly recommend STATS RESTAURANT and BAR as your 1st choice.   #DirtyFriesareBomb #ShestolemyFRY!!!! #Shestolemyheart #SheSaidYes

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Best Bubbly!!! #MyOpinion
Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. STATS 1st Engagement Party! Thank you for these beautiful cakes and thank you Lezlie for your hard work.

U7gXNKWcJCAwZOoncSQq1Q.text: Stats would be a great restaurant and bar if the service wasn't so slow and they deliver on advertised event. I went there today for brunch and a promised performance of Uptown Swagga at 4pm.  The band did not start until 6pm and in the meantime the music playing was so boring.  The lights flickering off and on. They are very short staffed and the manager needs to whip them into shape. Very disappointed today of the lack of professionalism and this business all together.

I16DLJWXzxrhUkgXrkr2oA.text: We got tickets through EventBrite for the free Sunday Brunch from 12-4. A go-go band was supposed to perform at 4. They didn't come to the stage until after 6pm. That was a disappointment since a lot of guest (like me) were from the DMV and really wanted to see them perform. There was only 1 bartender that took orders as the only server as well. She was very nice but slow service. Employees came in late to work as we arrived. No one seemed prepared. Guests were seated outside on the patio that were never served. They ended up coming in to be waited on. When the food finally came it was good but barely warm to the touch and it was brought out to each of us separately instead of serving the table as a whole. The hookah bar had employees smoking as well as patrons!  Unprofessionalism all around. The lounge/bar needs new management. It's large and has a lot of things not working properly. It needs the right person to make it a great establishment.

0Ly0W37PIT5lZ3749jW4vQ.text: Decent place but not enough parking. Came here for a private VIP bday party. Nice set up in VIP area. There was wings, mac and cheese, and green beans. They were all good

8Tpm5IhpKLZ_zLK2bFJNlg.text: The food was extremely good but the time it took for the food to get to us was close to an hour and it wasn't even busy. Staff was friendly and fairly attentive. If you come here don't expect top notch service, but expect the food to be well worth the wait.

photos.caption: Photo of STATS Restaurant & Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu front

L0acl6wlmJQJTx-Y_sPW6w.text: Went on a Wednesday night, advertising on social media stated 6.00 martinis. It did not specify which martinis were 6.00.  The server did not specify only certain drinks were on special. Upon ordering we were not told only certain drinks are on special. When we received the bill we were charged over 10.00 for the drink. Told the server and soon after then manager came and told us that they not certain drinks are on special and the server told us that. We explained to her that we were not told and that is not the advertised as certain martinis. The food was good as were the drinks. However they need to be clear when advertising.

K5xGk-8fVpuAT9e-QsyZ0g.text: Wish I would have read the reviews prior to coming here!  Came to this establishment All Star weekend.  Though it is a busy weekend I've been checking this place out for a while.  I saw Chef JR in DC endorse this establishment when it was opening and was happy to see something similar to what I'm used too.  I'm moving from the DC area so I was excited.  We Paid $1000 for a table for 6 people that came with two bottles.  Not bad at all given it was a busy weekend in Charlotte. The folks at the door was hooking their friends up and folks with tables stood out there for 45 minutes waiting to get in.  The group next to me was from Atlanta and they too were like nah this wouldn't be happening in the A.  I know it wouldn't happen in DC.  You pay for a table you get in period.  A lady who looked in charge came and put a stop to that.  We get it and it's a futon couch and a coffee table from Ikea that didn't fit 6 people at all!  We talk to a manager and she kind of blew us off.  The space was so small that it was ridiculous.    After the initial hour mess we did have a good time and I ordered the pasta dish which was good because they were out of lobster mac and cheese. This establishment seems it can possibly be nice if they treat customers a little better than taking their money, standing out in the cold and a BS coffee table and small futon.  Treat your customers well and they will endorse you.  Treat them like shhhh and they won't return and tell their friends of the horrible service.  Word of mouth is a powerful thing in business.

1ounHUUGIZJVZrejeSHM4w.text: The food was good and the service was on point. Ms. Monique was a great bartender. All of the other staff was friendly and welcoming. I had the lobster Mac and cheese and spinach crab dip was delish. Sorry I didn't get a pic of the lobster Mac and cheese. I guess my excitement took over! Lol. I will definitely be going back soon so I will capture it then. But there are other pics here that capture it. We sat at the bar which was perfect. The place was not crowded which was also perfect and laid back. Overall great experience!

qSKsMUJEHGT5I6y70rf2hg.text: This place used to be one of my favorite spots. The best dish was the lobster Mac and cheese. I've had it twice in the past month and both times, it was horrible! The 1st time, the tail was sent out dark and  appeared fried too long. I sent it back and realized that it wasn't that, the darn grease needed to be changed. It was DISGUSTING! Last night, I tried to give it another chance and it wasn't good at all. Everybody can't cook seafood and whoever has been cooking it lately really needs to be trained.
